encounters.message: You come across a rock. Of course, by 'come across', I mean you tripped over it. Smooth move. (-1 Health)
Fight the rock?
The rock doesn't really fight back, but you certainly feel stronger after punching it. (+1 Strength)
You're right, that rock is more trouble than it's worth. You put in your pocket though, now 0.1% of your body is armored! (+1 Defense)
That rock never stood a chance. The crater you leave is all that remains of its legacy. (+1 Stoicism)
You try to punch the rock, but before you can even clench your fist a snickering boulder pantses you! You run away, ashamed.
You mosey on your way, wondering what might have happenned if you had been more sensible...
Well... You died. What a waste of time. Try again?
You punch Death. It doesn't do anything, but he admits you've got balls. He restores your life at a cost.
You challenge Death to a game of darts. You win your life back, but in the process you may have lost an eye or two.
You find a book, but it looks like it's also... a loaf of bread? You'd have to see this thing to believe it.
You honestly didn't even notice dying, and you refuse to notice Death trying to get your attention. He eventually gets fed up and steals some of your armor, but hey, you're alive!
Even death is impressed at your health bar, so he offers you your life back... for half of it. Yay?
You talk it out with death, and by the time you're done, he's joined your pyramid scheme. Unfortunately, being part of a pyramid scheme in the first place has lessened your sensibility

You just stare death down. At first he thinks you're kidding, but after a few minutes it gets suuuper uncomfortable. He kinda just backs away and leaves you to your business. As he does, you crack a smile, losing a significant amount of Stoicism
This book has taught you a lot. Mostly that bread-books are poorly written. (+1 Sensibility)
It's baked a lot better than it was written. you feel bulkier... (+1 Strength, +1 Defense)

You eat about half of it, but then you start to feel guilty. Someone obviously worked pretty hard to write this on bread, maybe it was really good. You'll never know now, you just ate the table of contents like a jerk! It was filling though. (+1 Defense, +1 Stoicism, -1 Sensibility)
Either the sun was already setting, or it wussed out and you won. You're convinced it was the latter. (+3 Stoicism, -1 Sensibility, -5 Accuracy
You decide this is boring and punch the nearest thing you find. It was a cactus.
Nothing happens, you just wander the wastes for a while.
Yeah, ouch. Your hand is sore now. (-2 Health, -2 Strength)
You rush towards the cliff with reckless abandon and... And... AND...
You T-pose beside her on the cliff. After a few hours it becomes more of a competition to see who can hold it the longest. After a few more you consider quitting.

After watching for a while, it dawns on you that she isn't T-posing, she's practicing Tai-Chi. Your bad. You do learn some sweet techniques that you're definitely gonna practice at home, though. (+5 Accuracy, +1 Strength, +2 Sensibility)
What, do you want me to describe the despicable thing you just did? She's dead. Take your ill-earned loot and go away, you bad bad person.
You miss. By, like, a lot. She laughs at you as you hurdle off the cliff, dropping armor as you tumble. (-5 health, -2 defense)

You refuse to flinch, even when your arms go numb. After three days, you realize that she was a scarecrow all along. Huh, the more you know I guess.(+3 Sensibility, +3 Max Health, +3 Defense, +3 Stoicism)

Yes, you're right, through your armor you can't even feel exhaustion. I guess having your pockets full of rocks really protects you from any form of fatigue. That totally makes sense. Asshole. (+10 Stoicism, +5 Strength)
You weren't that into this dumb T-posing competition anyways. You let your arms fall and saunter off, leaving her to her business. Some say she's still there T-posing to this day...
You come across a woman T-posing on a cliff
Yes? Yes what? Yes you want me to describe your heinous murder? I'm not going to.
Look, I'm already uncomfortable with this whole situation, can we just move on?
Please? I'll give you stats! See? (+2 Strength, +2 Defense, +2 Sensibility, +10 Accuracy, +2 Max Health please dont hurt me)
Uhm- I'm not really supposed to... I guess I could give you these? But it's all I have! (+10 Strength, +10 Sensibilitypleasepleaseplease)
What? You can't do that. I'm not edible! What good would it do anyways? I'm not nutritious! I swear!
Hello, I have been assigned as your new Narrat-WHAT THE HELL HAVE YOU DONE?
Yes this! You're in a lot of trouble, young... person. I'm gonna take those stats back now, and we'll go back to the normal game.
And a bit more for good measure. You should learn to play the game properly. (-20 to all stats)
The ground opens up and...
What? Wait, hold on, you CAN'T JU-........(+10 to all stats)
Sir, I'm Officer Narrator. I need you to remain calm and talk to me. We have reason to believe you've eaten two prior narrators. Is this true?
I'm going to have to confiscate some of those stats for evidence while we get this sorted out in court. Until then, I'll fill in as your new narrator. (-30 to all stats)
Sir, you need to step back or I will have to use force. Sir! SI-.......................(+10 to all stats)
(From Outside) SIR, COME OUT WITH YOUR HANDS UP, WE HAVE YOU SURROUNDED BY A SQUADRON!

Hello, I'm your court appointed narrator. Ehhhhem... You exit with your hands up and you are tackled to the floor. Your ill-earned stats are reclaimed by the warriors of justice, and you are sent packing. (-40 to all stats)
HE'S COMING OUT, LOWER YOUR- OH GOD, MAN DOWN! OPEN FIRE! THIS CRAZY SONOVABITCH CANT TAKE US ALL........(+50 to all stats)
I have seen your methods, and I approve of them. However, I cannot let them continue. The narrators are not a force to be trifled with, fool. You may have your reward, but you may not keep it.
You pet the cat until it stops crying. It then realizes you're a stranger and runs away. (+10 Max Health, Fully Healed!)
You feel something under your foot and look down -OH MY GOD IT WAS A KITTEN'S PAW! You spaztically apologize and coddle the kitten, but he cries regardless. What are you going to do?
You run away before anyone can see you in a flustered, caring state. Looks like nobody saw.(+4 Stoicism)
You use youre incredible Strength Potential to revert the very concept of pain that you inflicted on the kitten. He will never be hurt again.(+5 Sensibility)
You adopt the cute lil furball and bring him along on your adventures. He's too smol to be a particularly powerful compainion, but he's a fierce little guy.(+2 to all Stats)
You climb to the tippy-top, where you can see.... just how little there is to see out here. Oh well, it was a workout.(+2 to Strength, +2 to defense)

You drift off reading some pretentious garbage and dream about White Hearts and Queens of Rabbits. It was one of those weird dreams you cant quite remember and dont much care to.(+2 Max Health, +5 Sensibility, Fully Healed!)

You punch the tree until your hands bleed... wait, that's not your blood? It's the tree's? Dear Jesus, that's not right. You finish that unholy business and fashion the bits and pieces into new equipment for yourself.
Jesus dude, really? That's dark, I wasn't gonna go there. Take your stat gains and leave, I'm offended.(+7 to Stoicism)
Uh-uh!
AND THEY SLAYED THE MIGHTY DRAGON! Gosh, I love that one. Tell me another? (+1 Strength)
You find the perfect tree! not too tall, stump next to it for footing, sturdy branches, it's the real deal!
AND IT WAS INVINCIBLE TO ALL BUT EROSION! A true classic! Tell me another? (+1 Defense)
AND HE FIRED AN ARROW INTO THE EYE OF THE GORGON, FREEING KIEL AND THE PEOPLE OF MANGORIA! I love a story with deep lore. Tell me another? (+1 Accuracy)
AND THEY KNEW ALL THE THINGS! It's a dense one, but fascinating. Tell me another? (+1 Sensibility)
AND HE.... Hey... That's really mean. (+1 Stoicism)
Oh... I guess... Okay. The ground decides not to open up and you move on. (+10 Stoicism)
You wind up in a cave, score! Looks like there's treasure here, but there's such a small exit... You can only take one treasure through it.
You seem to have stepped so hard you split the earth beneath you. You tumble down into the fissure, catching on...
You grasp a branch before falling too far, then proceed to bend the earth back into shape, using the branch as leverage. It's a reasonable workout. (+10 Strength, +10 Defense, +10 Max Health)
Through clever eyes and brilliant intuition, you deduce that you are asleep. Jolting awake, you feel accomplished at your deduction. (+10 Stoicism, +10 Sensibility, +10 Accuracy)
I'm bored. Tell me a story.
You grab a solid-looking sabre and slip out of the cave.
You don a chainmail vest and slip out of the cave.
You squint through your new stylish monocle and slip out of the cave.
You slip out of the cave while perusing your new book.
You aren't sure what to do with the steroids, but by not taking them, you gain Health as you slip out of the cave. (+10 Max Health)
You ignore the shinies, you only need yourself. (+10 Stoicism)
The gate doesn't even budge. You must not be strong enough... (Need 75 in all stats)
The gate gives way easily to your power. You get the feeling the road ahead is going to be more dangerous...
actions: let's not and say we did

encounters.message: **General Encounter Checker**
A large gate stands before you. The wastes seem to come to a stop.
Really its the cactus that got hurt in this situation. You do keep the spikes that jabbed you, though.

As the gate shuts behind you, the heat of the desert wastes fades quickly from your person. The blood-red sky stretches endlessly above you, and below is an endless expanse of asphalt. The Highway awaits its guests, tempting you with the signs of civilization in the distance.
It's a small choir, singing Ave Maria. They are just standing on the side of the highway, and appear to have no malicious intent.
They gratiously nod their heads as you put down 3 pesos, a looney, and 2 dimes. As you walk away, the singing stops. You turn around to find the group is vanished.
The choir seamlessly makes room for you in their ranks, and closes back in around you. As you open your mouth to sing along with them, you find the words to the song come to you with ease...
actions: oh, listen to a maiden's prayer...

encounters.message: You ask them to stop politely, and they apologize for being a bother and move on down the road to find somewhere more provate to sing. As a token of apology, they hand you a piece of sheet music. You feel a little bad for being a jerk, they were really nice folks.

As you return to the place where the choir was, you find one of their robes crumpled on the ground. It contains a sticky note that says 'Made you look'. You aren't sure if you've fallen victim to some sort of avant-garde prank or what, but you got a robe out of it, so whatever.
Their throats were probably getting sore, not your business. As you walk away you feel you are being watched, though...
Sorry, I misspoke. you come across slime. Not an entity, just some goop.
Out of nowhere, a rotten apple hits you in the side of the head! Looking up, you see a cherub sticking out his tongue and readying an arrow! Better act fast!
The notes pour from your throat with ease, and you feel at peace like you never have before. (Health Filled!)
actions: 'tis thou, 'tis thou canst save amid, despair...

encounters.message: You feel fulfilled. Loved. Accepted. The music and the robes swirl around you like a blanket of protection. (+10 Defense)
actions: we slumber safely till the morrow...

encounters.message: The comfort penetrates all your doubts and fears. You feel as if your mind is free of its limitations. (+10 Sensibility)
actions: oh maiden, see a maiden's sorrow

encounters.message: The voices get louder, the music sweeter, almost overpowering the din of the ground beneath you shaking. You feel empowered by their song. (+10 Strength)
As the sand swirls around you, you find yourself completely undisturbed by the demons that emerge from the choral robes. They do not matter to you. (+10 Stoicism)

Your song finishes and you slump over to the ground in exhaustion. Your mind fills with words, but they are unfamiliar. Your new powers merely an illusion, you stumble for a moment, recalculating your movements
You regain your balance and glance around the pit you found yourself in. One demon remained, the rest having shed their robes and facades and fled the cave.
Great idea, poke the flaming slime- What? I didn't mention it's on fire? Shit, sorry, it's on fire, glowing, and purple. Still wanna poke it?
You lick the raspberry jelly off the
There's something here.

As you dip your weapon into the slime, you feel... stupid, because the slime covers your weapon, making it duller. It is bigger though, making it easier to hit stuff with. Win some and lose some I guess?
I...Fine, you poke the flaming, glowing, purple slime. And you die.
Wow, it's almost like you're actually learning to make smart decisions. Are you ill? Here's take some health. And some sensibility, I'm worried about you. (+15 Sensibility, Health Filled!)
What? No fucking way. It's on FIRE, you're not immune to FIRE. you can't just change the rules.

Is that the slime? It covered your fist and now you can fire-punch but it doesn't burn you? FUCK THIS GAME, your ass should be dead, and this is bullshit. God I hate this job. Go take your stupid firepunch perk and get out of my sight.
Nope, not doing that again, you don't need two flaming hands. I won't allow it.
Wha- Oh shit, I messed up the sequencing. You lick the SLIME and
You know what? I hate you. the jelly was poison.(-20 Health)
(mumbling) dressed up like a hmm hmm dollar hmm hmm... trying hard to look like gary hmm hmm...
You come across a slime!
UH, yeah, I um, It's a song I like and- I didn't mean for you to hear that. Sorry, here take some stats and let's forget this happenned. (+7 to all stats!)
(mumbling) supa doopa, come lets mix where hmm-kefellers hmm hmm sticks hmumberellas in the mix... hmmbadumbadum Badum, do doo doo
...........-Ehem. Sorry. I thought the mic was off.
actions: it's alright, i like that song

encounters.message: Yes, well... Um, how long were you listening?
Crap, I have when people hear me sing, I sound awful.
...really? I mean, I wasn't really trying or anything, I was just kinda humming to myself...
(blushing) thanks.... Really, I appreciate that.
huh? Oh, I didn't notice you were wandering, so sorry. You find a beaver or something. It gives you some advice and you feel, uh...
(mumbling) hmmhmm bluena hmm hmm hmm where to go hmm why dont hm hmm hmm hmm-shun sits... puddinhm hmm hmm...
actions: was that putting on the ritz?

encounters.message: (it sounds like he's tap dancing now)
(He tapdances for a while before you hear a door close, it seems he has left his office)
Sure, the beaver's advice ripples through your muscles and rejuvinats your beaver-y power. (+15 Strength)
Sure, the beaver's advice resonates with you and you take it to heart. (+15 Sensibility)
Sure, the beaver whines about his troubles and you find you care less and less about the world. (+15 Stoicism)
Sure, the beaver advises you to aim with your eyes open. (+20 Accuracy)
Sure, the beaver tells you about Paleo, and you decide to try it. (+20 Max Health)
Sure, the beaver instructs you in the art of woodcrafting. You learn you can't bite through wood, being human, but the pain is a gift. (+15 Defense)
(Really? okay, uh, you slip into the narrator's office. There's a few things lying around that might be useful, but be quick, he could be back any second!)
There's nothing here.

(You put on the Narration Trousers, and you leave!) (muffled) Hey, my trousers are gone... I never really wear them while I narrate anyways, not like anyone can see me. Besides, it's hot in here and I like a cool bree- (It seems the narrator has accidentally unplugged his microphone)

(You snag the narrator's whip, but you really don't know how to weild the thing, so you tie it aroun your waist, and you leave!) (muffled) Hey, my dope replica whip is gone... I was totally gonna learn to use that thing one of these days. Man, it was an actual prop too- (It seems the narrator has accidentally unplugged his microphone)

(You don the narrator's roller skates, and you leave!) (muffled) Hey, my roller skates! HOW WILL PEOPLE KNOW I'M COOL IF I CANT ROLLER SKATE? (getting distant) JERRY, Did you take my roller skates? (It seems the narrator has left for now, its your chance to escape!)
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
There's nothing here.
